_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION OR AN EMERGENCY CONTACT: LOCATION MANAGER Telephone 507-886-4222

I. THE FACILITY POLICY

   A. THE OWNER, MANAGEMENT, AND EMPLOYEES OF UAP DISTRIBUTION, INC., HARMONY, MINNESOTA ARE COMMITTED TO THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. IF AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE SHOULD OCCUR, THE FACILITY IS PREPARED TO WORK WITH THE LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT, LEPC, OR OTHER AUTHORITIES, TO MITIGATE ANY RELEASE AND TO MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF THE RELEASE ON PEOPLE AND THE ENVIRONMENT.

II. FACILITY INFORMATION

   A. THE PRIMARY ACTIVITY AT THE FACILITY IS THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IN NURSE TANKS FOR SALE TO FARMERS. THE MAIN STORAGE TANK FOR THIS OPERATION IS LISTED UNDER A SEPERATE RMP. THE STORAGE TANK IS LOCATED ON A SEPERATE PIECE OF PROPERTY. THIS RMP COVERS ONLY THE FACILITYS MAIN OPERATION WHERE THE NURSE TANKS ARE TRANSPORTED TO BE WEIGHED AFTER FILLING AND SIT UNTIL THE GROWER PICKS UP THE TANK TO TRANSPORT TO HIS FARM. THE TANKS ARE ONLY ON THIS PROPERTY DURING THE MAIN USE SEASONS. 

   B. ANHYDROUS AMMONIA IS RECEIVED, STORED, AND DISTRIBUTED FOR APPLICATION ON CROPS AS FERTILIZER NUTRIENT.

   C. THE MAXIMUM QUANTITY STORED WOULD BE WOULD BE 4420 POUNDS IN A 1,000 GALLON NURSE TANK. *NOTE: MAXIMUM QUANTITY ALLOWED TO BE STORED IS 85% OF NURSE TANK SIZE. THE MAXIMUM AMOUNT OF PRODUCT ON SITE WOULD BE 53,000 POUNDS IN TWELVE 1,000 GALLON NURSE TANKS.

III. THE ACCIDENTAL RELEASE, PREVENTION PROGRAM

   A. THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTED THE PROVISIONS OF THE SAFETY REQUIREMENTS FOR THE STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA, K-61.1, PUBLISHED BY THE AMERICAN NATIONAL STANDARDS INSTITUTE INC.

   B. THE FACILITY HAS IMPLEMENTEDTHE STANDARDS OF THE U.S. OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (OSHA) 29 CFR 1910.111, STORAGE AND HANDLING OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.

IV. THE FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY

   A. THERE HAVE BEEN NO ACCIDENTAL RELEASES OF AN

HYDROUS AMMONIA THAT HAVE CAUSED ANY DEATH, INJURIES, OR SIGNIFICANT PROPERTY DAMAGE AT THE FACILITY, NOR HAVE RESULTED IN OFF SITE DEATHS, INJURIES, EVACUATIONS, SHELTERING IN PLACE, PROPERTY DAMAGE, OR ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE. 

V. THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

    A. THE FACILITY HAS A WRITTEN EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN, IN ACCORDANCE WITH OSHA STANDARD 29 CFR 1910.38. IN THE CASE OF AN UNCONTROLED RELEASE, LOCATION PERSONNEL WOULD NOTIFY AUTHORITIES AND EVACUATE. EMPLOYEES HAVE REVIEWED THE EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM  INCLUDING PRE-EMERGENCY PLANNING AND EMPLOYEE TRAINING

  B. THE FACILITY HAS PROVIDED TO THE STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITES, THE EMERGENCY PLANNING AND COMMUNITY RIGHT-TO-KNOW INFORMATION AS REQUIRED UNDER SARA TITLE III (EPCRA).

 C.  THE LOCATION IS INCLUDED IN THE COMMUNITY EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN. 

VI. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

   A. SAFETY IMPROVEMENT IS AN ONGOING PROCESS AT THE FACILITY. PERIODIC EVALUATIONS ARE PERFORMED TO ASSESS THE MAINTENANCE OF SAFE CONDITIONS AND EVALUATE EMPLOYEE TRAINING. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON THESE EVALUATIONS AND ANY RESULTING CHANGES ARE AVAILABLE AT THE FACILITY..
